replies.body: It actually isn't hard to avoid a killfarm if you know tactics to get through them. If you just charge through in hopes of them not seeing you, then the game will suck. A tactic that I use is sneaking along the outer edge of the map. If a diamond guy sees me, he would have to lean over to shoot me, which, in that case, a teammate could easily knock them off. Another tactic is to get on top of your spawn and fast-staircase, and try to get onto the diamond towers. From there, the killfarm could be easily avoided.

replies.body:
Idek why everyone complains about kfing, I literally just go to back of spawn, or somewhere and make bridges around the edge/tunnel. Depending on how aggro the kill farmers are, you can sometimes manage to bridge to one for your side mons and to the side of spawn. Bridge to the side of the main area, where kfers usually hole up, low and just sneak around the edge of that main area and bridge out to the other side. Since they're all pushed up, there should be next to no-one to stop you from getting the mons. Easy. 

If I ever start to get kf'd on Quintus, I'll start recording and try to avoid it.

replies.body:
Quintus is already on the McZone rots. There's no point putting a "popular" map onto a category of rotations it doesn't belong to.
McZone rotations are around for a reason. To preserve nostalgia, really.
Quintus is a map where kill farming is the norm, it annoys a lot of people, so why would you want to bring that annoyance onto other rotations?
